{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3212605,"name":"Lincoln","username":"frc4533-lincoln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-06-05T20:59:54.820Z","cooked":"

I want to run Rust on my team’s robot without using WPILib. I’m fairly new to FRC, but am very comfortable with Rust, programming, and Linux. I was hoping I could get some advice from a WPILib dev on how to go about this.
I’m particularly interested in how to interface with the roboRIO: I can’t find a library or decent documentation on how to do so. As I understand it, the roboRIO is a Linux box with a collection of libraries on it. Where should I get said libraries for development use? I’m on Gentoo, so Ubuntu packages are out of the question.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-05T20:59:54.820Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":349,"reads":394,"readers_count":393,"score":1823.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":437907,"topic_slug":"rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib","display_username":"Lincoln","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59640,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib/437907/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3212613,"name":"","username":"Autumn-Ou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumn-ou/{size}/192598_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-05T21:03:49.736Z","cooked":"

Okay so yes you can but not recommended to go fully without WPILib and you’ll be relying on bindgen a lot for c++ libs

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-05T21:03:49.736Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":382,"readers_count":381,"score":96.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":437907,"topic_slug":"rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Making funky products"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib/437907/2","custom_user_title":"Making funky products","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212644,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-05T22:50:58.302Z","cooked":"

You might want to check out this unofficial library… the last release was ~4 years ago but there’s more recent commit history than that.

GitHub

GitHub - first-rust-competition/first-rust-competition: Rusty Robots:...

Rusty Robots: https://crates.io/crates/wpilib and https://crates.io/crates/cargo-frc - GitHub - first-rust-competition/first-rust-competition: Rusty Robots: https://crates.io/crates/wpilib and http...

The roboRIO runs a NI-customized installation of Linux with additional FRC-specific libraries installed. The FRC-specific library headers can be found here: GitHub - wpilibsuite/ni-libraries: Houses the NI Libraries for WPILib building, and the main image libraries can be downloaded separately from their package repository here: https://download.ni.com/#ni-linux-rt/feeds/academic/2023/arm/

Also, WPILib builds a cross-compiler toolchain to Rio that can be found here: GitHub - wpilibsuite/opensdk

Note it’s likely a lot easier to wrap WPILib’s HAL (Hardware Abstraction Layer) than use the NI FRC libraries directly. The HAL is a C API, while some of the NI FRC libraries are C++ (namely the FPGA interfaces).

I know, I’m not doing it to avoid learning a new language. I want to do it because I’ll learn a lot more about how FRC robots work.
As a few others have suggested, I will definitely use the WPILib HAL if I make my own library.

As a note, it appears they’re still building for 2022. You’ll probably have to fix that on your own

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T14:45:56.733Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":51.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":437907,"topic_slug":"rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib","display_username":"Levi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59640,"username":"frc4533-lincoln","name":"Lincoln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/76d3ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49892,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com"},"post_url":"/t/rust-for-frc-robots-w-o-wpilib/437907/11","custom_user_title":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212794,"name":"Bob","username":"bobbbay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T18:03:33.802Z","cooked":"

Creator of Arfur here. Yeah, we’re working on some higher-level robotics stuff before getting back to updating the WPILib bindings. The problem is that once the 2023 API was stabilized, WPILib releases a pre-release for 2024 :). So it’s hard to decide which bindings to use. We’ll probably just update straight to v2024-prerelease and just skip a step. This is all experimental, anyways.

Any help would really be appreciated, we’re a low-staff team. If anyone wants to help, I would love to help explain the codebase so we can work on updates and features.

Let me know if you have any questions.
